summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Christopher J. Dodd. The documents primarily concern the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) handling of House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. These records include final determination notifications regarding the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy, payroll records for various HSCA staff members like Wendy S. Collins, Kenneth D. Klein, and Denise L. McCray, and requests for information from the CIA regarding their 201 file criteria. The documents focus on administrative and privacy-related decisions concerning HSCA personnel records rather than any specific investigation or findings related to the JFK assassination itself.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Christopher J. Dodd has no significance in the JFK context.
